Routes¶

index_url¶

int: Module level variable documented inline.

The docstring may span multiple lines. The type may optionally be specified on the first line, separated by a colon.

app.api.routes.index_url.get_embeddings(chunk)[source]¶
app.api.routes.index_url.index_url()[source]¶

This endpoint expects a URL in the format {“url”: “https://www.example.com”} and is responsible for: 1. instantiating the web-crawler that will extract the webpage’s content 2. store the output into a generic database.

Parameters:

url (str) – The website URL for which you want to interact with.

Example

One can send a POST request to where this is hosted as:

$ curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{"url": "https://example.com"}' http://localhost:4000/v1/index_url

Todo

  • make async pool

app.api.routes.index_url.split_into_max_tokens(tokens, max_chunk_size=1024, intersection=0)[source]¶

ask¶

app.api.routes.ask.ask_question()[source]¶

This endpoint expects an input body in the form {“url”:”https://www.example.com/”, “question”:”what is your name?”}

Parameters:

  • url (str) – The website URL for which you want to interact with.

  • question (str) – The question you want the LLM to answer based on the URL.

Example

One can send a POST request to where this is hosted as:

$ curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{"url": "https://example.com", "question":"What is the purpose of this domain?"}' http://localhost:4000/v1/ask

Todo

  • Add response streaming feature

app.api.routes.ask.cosine_similarity(vec_a, vec_b)[source]¶

Measures the cosine angle between vector A and vector B.

app.api.routes.ask.generate_text_response(stream)[source]¶
